source_file: WORLD WAR Z (12.03.10) - Matthew Michael Carnhan, J. Michael Straczynski.pdf

metadata.filename: WORLD WAR Z (12.03.10) - Matthew Michael Carnhan, J. Michael Straczynski.pdf

analysis.title: World War Z
analysis.author: J. Michael Straczynski, Matthew Michael Carnahan
analysis.logline: A UN investigator travels the globe seeking a way to combat a rapidly spreading zombie pandemic that threatens human extinction.

concept.justification: Unique global perspective on zombie apocalypse, focusing on systemic response rather than individual survival

structure.justification: Episodic global journey with clear narrative progression, strong act breaks, sustained momentum

protagonist.justification: Gerry Lane is complex, active, driven by family and global survival, with clear transformation

supporting_cast.justification: Diverse, memorable characters like Segen, Thierry, Simon with distinct voices and purposes

dialogue.justification: Sharp, economic dialogue with subtext, characters sound distinct, minimal exposition

genre_execution.justification: Masterful zombie genre execution, innovative approach to global pandemic narrative

originality.justification: Reimagines zombie genre with geopolitical and systemic analysis, fresh global perspective

cast_attachability.note: Strong lead role for A-list actor

budget_return_ratio.note: High potential for international box office

comparable_success.note: Similar success with World War Z (2013) film

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Act 1: Personal survival to global mission; Act 2: Global investigation; Act 3: Finding solution in Russia

characters.protagonist: Gerry Lane - UN investigator driven to save family and humanity, clear goal of finding zombie pandemic origin
characters.antagonist: The zombie pandemic itself, systemic global unpreparedness

standout_scenes.scene: Battle of Philadelphia initial zombie outbreak
standout_scenes.why: Visceral, chaotic introduction to global pandemic
Innovative zombie attack strategy, high-stakes geopolitical tension
Brilliant tactical zombie warfare, innovative cold-based survival strategy

comparable_films.title: World War Z (2013)
comparable_films.similarity: Global zombie narrative, different specific approach

budget_tier.justification: Global locations, massive set pieces, significant VFX requirements

strengths: Global systemic approach to zombie narrative
assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptional screenplay with perfect weighted score of 8.65, no critical failures, maximum commercial viability score of 18, and extraordinary global narrative approach

film_now_assessment.lightning_test: Initial Philadelphia zombie outbreak sequence creates immediate tension and narrative urgency
goosebumps_moments: Page 6: Zombie transformation of father in Philadelphia
Page 118: Russian Red Square victory moment
film_now_assessment.career_risk_test: Would absolutely stake professional reputation on this screenplay
film_now_assessment.legacy_potential: Likely to be remembered as groundbreaking zombie narrative

analysis.verdict_statement: FILM NOW: World War Z represents exceptional material that demands immediate greenlight consideration. The Lightning: A global systemic approach to zombie apocalypse that redefines the genre. The Craft: Weighted score of 8.65 with no dimension below 8. The Commercial Case: CVS of 18/18. Brad Pitt or similar A-list actor presents star potential. Urgency: This screenplay will not remain available.
